intro: Chondroscaphe flaveola, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its yellow flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late spring or early summer. The leaves are generally narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the dry conditions of its habitat.
